# coding: utf-8
# usr/bin/python37

'''
Determine Stress, Strain, Youngs Modulus
form Load and Deflection as input
'''
from tkinter import messagebox, Button, Frame, Tk, Toplevel, BooleanVar, StringVar, Checkbutton, Radiobutton, OptionMenu, Entry, Label
from matplotlib.backends.backend_tkagg import FigureCanvasTkAgg, NavigationToolbar2Tk
from tkinter.filedialog import askopenfilename  # Collect User input
from matplotlib.offsetbox import AnchoredText   # Show more details on figure
from matplotlib.figure import Figure
from csv import reader as csv_reader  # Read csv file
from sys import exit  # Exit on error
import numpy as np  # Required for Matplotlib and to run complex calculations
from os.path import abspath, isdir, exists
from scipy.signal import butter, filtfilt
from matplotlib import use as matuse
matuse('TkAgg')



[docs]class ElasticModulus:

    def __init__(self, master):
        '''
        Plot Stress Strain and Elastic modulus

        :param master: tkinter Tk object to push widgets to
        :type master: tk.TK
        '''
        # Initialize the plot figure
        self.fig = Figure()
        self.fig.subplots_adjust(right=.85)
        self.sub = self.fig.add_subplot(1, 1, 1)
        self.sub2 = self.sub.twinx()
        self.root = master

        # Customizable Variables
        self.materialArea = 1
        self.offsetLinePercent = 0.2
        self.alphaValue: float = 0.2
        self.derivativeSmoothness: int = 30
        self.butterOrder = 2
        self.butterCutOff = .1
        self.stressStrainColor = 'blue'
        self.derivativeColor = 'red'

        self.initDeflection = None
        self.loads = None
        self.deflections = None
        self.loadUnit = "N"
        self.deflectionUnit = 'mm'
        self.areaUnit = 'mm'
        self.xsUnit = 'mm/mm'
        self.ysUnit = 'Pa'

        self.root.withdraw()
        self.root.update()
        self.processFile()
        self.root.deiconify()

        # Convert Load and Deflection to Stress and Strain
        self.xs: np.ndarray = abs(
            self.deflections-self.initDeflection)/self.initDeflection
        self.ys: np.ndarray = self.loads/self.materialArea

        # Initialize the Tk elements
        self.setupTk()
        self.calculate()
        self.plot()
        self.update()


[docs]    def setupTk(self) -> None:
        '''
        Setup Tkinter Integration with Matplotlib
        '''

        # Top Frame
        self.topFrame = Frame(self.root, background="white")

        # Material Area
        Label(self.topFrame, text="Width: ",
              background="white").pack(side='left')
        self.widthWidget = Entry(self.topFrame, width=5)
        self.widthWidget.pack(side='left')
        Label(self.topFrame, text="Thickness: ",
              background="white").pack(side='left')
        self.thicknessWidget = Entry(self.topFrame, width=5)
        self.widthWidget.insert('end', str(self.materialArea))
        self.thicknessWidget.insert('end', str(self.materialArea))
        self.thicknessWidget.pack(side='left')

        self.areaUnitWidget = StringVar(self.topFrame)
        self.areaUnitWidget.set(self.areaUnit)  # default value
        dropDown = OptionMenu(self.topFrame, self.areaUnitWidget, 'mm', "cm",
                              "m", "in", command=self.update)
        dropDown.pack(side='left')
        dropDown["highlightthickness"] = 0
        dropDown["background"] = 'lightgray'

        Label(self.topFrame, text="Output: ",
              background="white").pack(side='left')
        self.outUnitWidget = StringVar(self.topFrame)
        self.outUnitWidget.set("MPa")  # default value
        dropDown = OptionMenu(self.topFrame, self.outUnitWidget, 'Pa', "MPa",
                              "GPa", command=self.update)
        dropDown.pack(side='left')
        dropDown["highlightthickness"] = 0
        dropDown["background"] = 'white'
        dropDown["background"] = 'lightgray'

        # Offset line
        Label(self.topFrame, text="Offset Percent: ",
              background="white").pack(side='left')
        self.offsetLineWidget = Entry(self.topFrame, width=4)
        self.offsetLineWidget.pack(side='left')
        self.offsetLineWidget.insert('end', str(self.offsetLinePercent))

        self.dydxsmoothwidget = Entry(self.topFrame, width=4)
        self.dydxsmoothwidget.insert('end', str(self.derivativeSmoothness))

        Button(master=self.topFrame, text='Filters', fg='black', bg='lightblue',
               borderwidth=0, highlightthickness=0, command=self.tuneSmoothness).pack(side='left')
        self.toplevelOpen = False
        self.filterType = 'movingAverage'

        # Graphs selector
        Label(self.topFrame, text=" Graphs:",
              background="white").pack(side='left')
        self.derivative_state = BooleanVar()
        self.derivative_state.set(True)
        Checkbutton(self.topFrame, variable=self.derivative_state, text='Derivative', command=self.update,
                    fg='black', bg='white', borderwidth=0, highlightthickness=0).pack(side='left')
        # Failure Line
        self.guideline_state = BooleanVar()
        self.guideline_state.set(True)
        Checkbutton(self.topFrame, variable=self.guideline_state,
                    text='Guide Lines ', command=self.update,
                    fg='black', bg='white', borderwidth=0, highlightthickness=0).pack(side='left')
        # Update button
        Button(master=self.topFrame, text='Refresh', fg='black', bg='lightblue',
               borderwidth=0, highlightthickness=0, command=self.update).pack(side='right')
        self.topFrame.pack(fill='x')
        # Tk Canvas
        self.canvas = FigureCanvasTkAgg(self.fig, master=self.root)
        self.canvas.get_tk_widget().pack(side='top', fill='both', expand=1)
        self.canvas._tkcanvas.pack(side='top', fill='both', expand=1)

        # New file button
        Button(master=self.root, text='NewFile', fg='black', bg='lightblue', borderwidth=0,
               highlightthickness=0, command=self.readNewFile).pack(side='right')
        NavigationToolbar2Tk(self.canvas, self.root).update()
        # Handle quit protocol
        self.root.protocol("WM_DELETE_WINDOW", self._quit)
        self.root.bind('<Return>', self._returnKey)
        self.root.bind('<Control-w>', self._quitSignal)
        self.root.bind('<Control-q>', self._quitSignal)



[docs]    def tuneSmoothness(self):
        '''
        Create popup window for data smoothness filter
        '''
        if not self.toplevelOpen:
            self.toplevelOpen = True
            self.win = Toplevel()
            self.win.configure(background='white')
            self.win.wm_title("Filters")


            self.filterWidget = StringVar()
            self.filterWidget.set(self.filterType)

            Radiobutton(self.win, text="Moving Average", variable=self.filterWidget,
                        value="movingAverage", bg='white', borderwidth=0, highlightthickness=0).grid(row=1, column=0)

            Label(self.win, text="Box size: ",
                  background="white").grid(row=2, column=0)
            self.dydxsmoothwidget = Entry(self.win, width=4)
            self.dydxsmoothwidget.insert('end', str(self.derivativeSmoothness))
            self.dydxsmoothwidget.grid(row=2, column=1)


            Radiobutton(self.win, text="Butter Worth", variable=self.filterWidget,
                        value="butterWorth", bg='white', borderwidth=0, highlightthickness=0).grid(row=3, column=0)
            Label(self.win, text="Order: ",
                  background="white").grid(row=4, column=0)
            self.butterOrderWidget = Entry(self.win, width=4)
            self.butterOrderWidget.insert('end', str(self.butterOrder))
            self.butterOrderWidget.grid(row=4, column=1)
            Label(self.win, text="Cutoff: ",
                  background="white").grid(row=5, column=0)
            self.butterCutOffWidget = Entry(self.win, width=4)
            self.butterCutOffWidget.insert('end', str(self.butterCutOff))
            self.butterCutOffWidget.grid(row=5, column=1)
            

            Button(self.win, text="OK", command=self.destroyToplevel,fg='black', bg='lightblue', borderwidth=0, highlightthickness=0).grid(
                row=9, column=1)
            self.root.bind('<Return>', self.destroyToplevel)
            self.win.protocol("WM_DELETE_WINDOW", self.destroyToplevel)



[docs]    def destroyToplevel(self, *a, **k):
        '''
        Destroy the tcl interpreter and tk for popup toplevel widget
        '''
        self.toplevelOpen = False
        try:
            self.derivativeSmoothness = int(self.dydxsmoothwidget.get(
            )) if self.dydxsmoothwidget.get().replace('.', '', 1).isdigit() else self.derivativeSmoothness
            if self.butterCutOffWidget.get().replace('.', '', 1).isdigit():
                if float(self.butterCutOffWidget.get()) > 0 and float(self.butterCutOffWidget.get()) < 1:
                    self.butterCutOff = float(self.butterCutOffWidget.get())
            self.butterOrder = int(self.butterOrderWidget.get(
            )) if self.butterOrderWidget.get().replace('.', '', 1).isdigit() else self.butterOrder
            self.filterType = self.filterWidget.get()
        except:
            pass
        self.update()
        self.win.destroy()



[docs]    def getStressPascal(self):
        if self.areaUnit.strip() == 'mm':
            self.ys = self.ys * 1000000
        if self.areaUnit.strip() == 'cm':
            self.ys = self.ys * 10000
        if self.areaUnit.strip() == 'm':
            pass
        if self.areaUnit.strip() == 'in':
            self.ys = self.ys * 1550.003

        self.ysUnit = 'Pa'

        if self.outUnit.strip() == 'Pa':
            pass
            self.ysUnit = 'Pa'
        if self.outUnit.strip() == 'MPa':
            self.ys = self.ys / 1000000
            self.ysUnit = 'MPa'
        if self.outUnit.strip() == 'GPa':
            self.ys = self.ys / 1000000000
            self.ysUnit = 'GPa'



[docs]    def updateVariables(self) -> None:
        '''
        Update the variables based on the retrived values form GUI
        '''

        self.xsUnit = f"{self.deflectionUnit}/{self.deflectionUnit}"
        self.ysUnit = f"{self.loadUnit}/{self.areaUnit}^2"
        self.materialArea = float(self.widthWidget.get())*float(self.thicknessWidget.get(
        )) if self.widthWidget.get().replace('.', '', 1).isdigit(
        ) and self.thicknessWidget.get().replace('.', '', 1).isdigit() else self.materialArea
        self.offsetLinePercent = float(self.offsetLineWidget.get(
        )) if self.offsetLineWidget.get().replace('.', '', 1).isdigit(
        ) else self.offsetLinePercent
        self.areaUnit = self.areaUnitWidget.get()
        self.outUnit = self.outUnitWidget.get()
        self.xs: np.ndarray = abs(
            self.deflections-self.initDeflection)/self.initDeflection
        self.ys: np.ndarray = self.loads/self.materialArea
        self.getStressPascal()



[docs]    def update(self, *a, **k) -> None:
        '''
        Update the tcl tkinter plot
        '''
        self.updateVariables()
        self.calculate()
        self.sub.clear()
        self.sub2.clear()
        self.plot()
        self.fig.canvas.draw()
        self.fig.canvas.flush_events()



[docs]    def calculate(self) -> None:
        '''
        Run all the necessary calculations
        '''
        # Solve for the derivative of the Stress strain Curve
        self.dydx = self.derivative()
        if self.filterType  == 'movingAverage':
            self.dydxSmooth = self.rollingAverage(
            self.dydx, self.derivativeSmoothness)
        elif self.filterType == 'butterWorth':
            self.dydxSmooth = self.butterWorth(self.dydx, self.butterOrder, self.butterCutOff)

        # Determine the elastic region based on the relative derivative
        self.eRegion = self.getElasticRegion()



[docs]    def plot(self) -> None:
        '''
        Run all the matplotlib operations to inject into Tkinter
        '''
        # Title for the figure
        self.sub.title.set_text('MTS EM Compression (Deflectometer)')
        # Max slope Equation
        self.MaxSlope, self.MaxIntercept, self.offsetLinePts = self.drawMaximumLine()

        self.calculate()

        # plotDeflectionLoad(deflection, load)
        self.plotStrainStress()
        # Plot Relative derivative
        if self.derivative_state.get():
            self.plotRelativeDerivative()
        if self.guideline_state.get():
            self.plotVertNHorLines()

        # self.plotAnchoredText(['Max Slope Equation', self.MaxSlopeEq])
        self.plotAnchoredText([
            ['Elastic modulus', str(round(self.MaxSlope)) + self.ysUnit],
            ['Yield Offset points', 'strain:' +
                str(round(self.offsetLinePts[0], 3)) + '; stress:' + str(round(self.offsetLinePts[1], 3)), '\n'],
            ['Maximum stress', round(self.eRegion[-1][1], 3)]])

        # Creates the legend for the plot
        self.sub.legend(loc='upper left')
        self.sub.ticklabel_format(useOffset=False, style='plain')
        self.sub2.ticklabel_format(useOffset=False, style='plain')



[docs]    def getFilename(self, firstFile) -> str:
        '''
        Created a Tkinter gui to retrive user provided filename

        :param firstFile: The first request for file
        :type firstFile: bool
        :return: The name of the file
        :rtype: str
        '''
        # Withdraw the main tkinter window
        # Tk().withdraw()
        # Userinput for the filename
        filename: str = askopenfilename(title='Choose CSV Data File')
        # Handle if no filename is provided
        if isinstance(filename, tuple) or filename is '' or isdir(filename):
            # Popup feedback
            messagebox.showerror('No Files', 'No files were provided')
            # Exit with a message
            if firstFile:
                exit('ERROR: No files were provided')
        # Handle if wrong filetype is provided
        elif 'csv' not in filename.lower():
            # Popup feedback
            messagebox.showerror(
                'Unsupported type',
                'Incorrect File type!\nONLY "csv" supported')
            # Exit with a message
            if firstFile:
                exit('ERROR: Incorrect File type')

        if firstFile:
            return filename
        else:
            return self.filename



[docs]    def processFile(self, firstFile=True) -> None:
        '''
        Read the file and setup initial deflection, loads and deflections
        '''
        self.filename = self.getFilename(firstFile)
        # Initialize variables
        deflectionAndLoad: dict = {}
        # open the user defined file
        header = []
        inHeader = True
        units = None
        with open(self.filename, 'r') as csvfile:
            plots = csv_reader(csvfile, delimiter=',')
            # for skips in range(skiplines):
            #     next(plots)
            for row in plots:
                # Skip the details and definition portion
                if row[0].replace('.', '', 1).replace('-', '', 1).isdigit():
                    inHeader = False
                    # Append the loads the deflections
                    deflectionAndLoad[float(row[3])] = float(row[1])
                else:
                    if inHeader:
                        header.append(row)

        # return initial deflection, loads and deflections as tuple
        self.initDeflection = np.fromiter(
            deflectionAndLoad.keys(), dtype=float)[0]
        self.loads = np.fromiter(deflectionAndLoad.values(), dtype=float)[1:]
        self.deflections = np.fromiter(
            deflectionAndLoad.keys(), dtype=float)[1:]
        self.deflectionUnit = header[-1][3]
        self.loadUnit = header[-1][1]



[docs]    def readNewFile(self) -> None:
        '''
        Read a new file
        '''
        self.processFile(firstFile=False)
        self.update()



[docs]    def derivative(self) -> np.ndarray:
        '''
        Find the derivative

        :return: array of the derivative
        :rtype: np.ndarray
        '''
        # Return the derivative
        return np.divide(np.diff(self.ys), np.diff(self.xs),
                         out=np.zeros_like(np.diff(self.xs)), where=np.diff(self.xs) != 0)



[docs]    def plotRelativeDerivative(self, ls='-') -> None:
        '''
        Plot the Derivative relative to y-axis

        :param ls: linestyle, defaults to '-'
        :type ls: str, optional
        '''

        # Solve for relative derivative corrolated to the y-axis
        # self.dydxRelative = self.dydxSmooth / \
        # (np.max(self.dydxSmooth)/np.max(self.ys))
        self.dydxRelative = self.dydxSmooth
        # Plot the relative derivative against strain
        self.sub2.set_ylabel('dydx', color=self.derivativeColor)
        self.sub2.axhline(y=0, ls='--', color='gray')
        if len(self.dydxSmooth[:len(self.eRegion)])>50:
            self.sub2.plot(self.xs[8:], self.dydxRelative[7:],
                       ls=ls, color=self.derivativeColor)
        else:
            self.sub2.plot(self.xs[1:], self.dydxRelative,
                       ls=ls, color=self.derivativeColor)



[docs]    def plotStrainStress(self) -> None:
        '''
        Plot the Strain and Stress
        '''
        # Set X-axis label
        self.sub.set_xlabel(f'Strain [{self.xsUnit}]')
        # Set Y-axis label
        self.sub.set_ylabel(
            f'Stress [{self.ysUnit}]', color=self.stressStrainColor)
        # Plot the strain and stress on the figure
        self.sub.plot(self.xs, self.ys, label='Stress and Strain',
                      color=self.stressStrainColor)



[docs]    def slopeInterceptLine(self, slope, intercept, color='', ls='-', label='', length=50, numberOfXs=50, shiftInX=None, _return=False, draw=True) -> None:
        '''
        Create a line provided the slope and intercept

        :param slope: Slope of the line
        :type slope: float or int
        :param intercept: Y-intercept of the line
        :type intercept: float or int
        :param color: color of the line, defaults to ''
        :type color: str, optional
        :param ls: Style of the line, defaults to '-'
        :type ls: str, optional
        :param label: Label for the line, defaults to ''
        :type label: str, optional
        :param length: Length of the line, defaults to 50
        :type length: int, optional
        :param numberOfXs: number of x-values, defaults to 50
        :type numberOfXs: int, optional
        :param shiftInX: Shift the line along x-axis, defaults to None
        :type shiftInX: int, optional
        :param draw: draw the plot to screen, defaults to True
        :type draw: bool, optional
        :param _return: return the xs, ys, x-min and x-max, defaults to False
        :type _return: bool, optional
        :return: tuple of lists if _return == True
        :rtype: tuple
        '''
        # If a shift in X-axis is defined
        if shiftInX:
            intercept = intercept-(slope*shiftInX)
        # Create equally spaces array and ones visible beyond X-intercept
        xs = np.array(np.linspace((-intercept/slope),
                                  (-intercept/slope)+length, num=numberOfXs))
        # Solve for y-values with Y=MX+B formula
        ys = (slope * xs) + intercept
        # Plot the line on the figure
        if draw:
            self.sub.plot(xs, ys, f'{color}{ls}', label=label)
        if _return:
            return xs, ys, (-intercept/slope), (-intercept/slope)+length



[docs]    def rollingAverage(self, data: np.ndarray, box_pts: int) -> np.ndarray:
        '''
        Smooth numpy arrays using a box filter

        :param data: array to smooth out
        :type data: np.ndarray
        :param box_pts: strength of smoothness, box size
        :type box_pts: int
        :return: smooth numpy array
        :rtype: np.ndarray
        '''
        # Smoothout the curve with the size of max array
        return np.convolve(data, np.ones(box_pts)/box_pts, mode='same')



[docs]    def butterWorth(self, data, order, cutoff) -> np.ndarray:
        # First, design the Buterworth filter
        N = order    # Filter order
        Wn = cutoff  # Cutoff frequency
        B, A = butter(N, Wn, output='ba')

        # Second, apply the filter
        newdata = filtfilt(B, A, data)

        # Smoothout the curve with the size of max array
        return newdata



[docs]    def getElasticRegion(self) -> np.ndarray:
        '''
        Get the elastic region based on the derivative

        :return: Points within Elastic Region
        :rtype: np.ndarray
        '''
        region: list = []
        # Iterate over all derivative valuescr
        for index in range(1, len(self.dydxSmooth)):
            # Append to elasticRegion while derivative is greater than 0
            if self.dydxSmooth[index] > 0:
                region.append([self.xs[index], self.ys[index]])
            else:
                # break when derivative is less than 0
                break
        # return variable
        return np.array(region)



[docs]    def intersectionIDX(self, f, g):
        '''
        Find the intersection index for function f an g

        :param f: array of points for f(f) in terms of y-values
        :type f: array
        :param g: array of points for f(g) in terms of y-values
        :type g: array
        :return: list of intersections
        :rtype: int or list
        '''
        return np.argwhere(np.diff(np.sign(f - g))).flatten()



[docs]    def drawMaximumLine(self) -> tuple:
        '''
        Draws the maximum slope line

        :return: tuple of the slope and intercept
        :rtype: str
        '''
        index = np.where(self.dydxSmooth == np.max(
            self.dydxSmooth[:len(self.eRegion)]))[0][0]
        xInt = (-(self.ys[index] - (self.xs[index] *
                                    self.dydxSmooth[index]))/self.dydxSmooth[index])
        # Toe correceted xs
        self.xs = self.xs - xInt
        if len(self.dydxSmooth[:len(self.eRegion)])>50:
            index = np.where(self.dydxSmooth == np.max(
            self.dydxSmooth[7:len(self.eRegion)]))[0][0]
        else:
            index = np.where(self.dydxSmooth == np.max(
            self.dydxSmooth[:len(self.eRegion)]))[0][0]
        slope = self.dydxSmooth[index]
        yInt = self.ys[index] - (
            self.xs[index]*slope)
        lenLine = (max(self.ys)-yInt)/slope

        # Maximum Slope
        self.slopeInterceptLine(slope, yInt,
                                label='Maximum Slope', length=lenLine, ls='--')

        # Offset yield Line
        offsetlinepoints = \
            self.slopeInterceptLine(slope, yInt, shiftInX=self.offsetLinePercent/100,
                                    length=lenLine, numberOfXs=len(self.xs), _return=True, draw=False)
        lineIDX = np.where(np.logical_and(
            self.xs >= offsetlinepoints[2], self.xs <= offsetlinepoints[3]))[0]
        lineYs = np.array([self.ys[index] for index in lineIDX])

        offsetlinepoints = \
            self.slopeInterceptLine(slope, yInt, shiftInX=self.offsetLinePercent/100,
                                    label=f"{float(self.offsetLinePercent)}% Offset line", length=lenLine, ls='--', numberOfXs=len(lineIDX), _return=True)
        # find intersection of yield line and stress and strain curve
        intIDX = self.intersectionIDX(lineYs, offsetlinepoints[1])
        return slope, yInt, (float(offsetlinepoints[0][intIDX]), float(offsetlinepoints[1][intIDX]))



[docs]    def plotVertNHorLines(self) -> None:
        '''
        Plot all vertical and Horizontal lines
        '''
        # Base horizontal line
        # Horizontal line at y=0
        self.sub.axhline(y=0, ls='-', c='black')
        # Bse vertical line
        # Vertical line for min strain
        self.sub.axvline(x=np.min(self.xs), ls='-.', alpha=self.alphaValue)
        # Vertical line for toe min strain
        self.sub.axvline(x=0, ls='-.', alpha=self.alphaValue)
        # Yield offset Line
        self.sub.axvline(
            x=self.offsetLinePts[0], ls='-.', alpha=self.alphaValue)
        self.sub.axhline(
            y=self.offsetLinePts[1], ls='-.', alpha=self.alphaValue)
        # Vertical line for max elasticRegion
        self.sub.axvline(x=self.eRegion[-1][0], ls='-.', alpha=self.alphaValue)
        # Horizontal line for max elasticRegion
        self.sub.axhline(y=self.eRegion[-1][1], ls=':', alpha=1.0)
        # point of yield
        self.sub.plot(self.eRegion[-1][0], self.eRegion[-1][1], 'r.')

        # Failure Lines
        # Vertical line for max strain
        self.sub.axvline(x=np.max(self.xs), ls='-.', alpha=self.alphaValue)
        # Horizontal line for max stress
        self.sub.axhline(y=np.max(self.ys), ls='-.', alpha=self.alphaValue)



[docs]    def plotAnchoredText(self, lists, location='lower right') -> None:
        '''
        Plots anchored text on the graph

        :param lists: List containing the Name and Equation [name, eq]
        :type lists: list
        :param location: Placement of the Anchored text, defaults to 'lower right'
        :type location: str, optional
        '''
        # Equation for the elastic region
        text = ''
        for index in range(len(lists)):
            newline = '\n' if len(lists[index]) > 2 else ''
            if index > 0:
                text += '\n'
            text += f'{lists[index][0]}: {newline}{lists[index][1]}'
        anchoredTxt = AnchoredText(text, loc=location)
        # self.sub.add_artist(anchoredTxt)
        self.sub2.add_artist(anchoredTxt)



[docs]    def mainloop(self):
        '''
        Enter Tkinter in the mainloop
        '''
        self.root.mainloop()



[docs]    def _quitSignal(self, event):
        "Handle the quit signal event"
        self._quit()



[docs]    def _returnKey(self, event):
        "Handle the retrun key update event"
        self.update()



[docs]    def _quit(self):
        '''
        Quit the tlc interpreter and all widgets
        '''
        if messagebox.askquestion('Exit Application', 'Are you sure you want to exit the application?', icon='warning') == 'yes':
            self.root.withdraw()
            self.root.quit()
            self.root.destroy()



if __name__ == '__main__':
    root = Tk()
    root.title("MTS EM")
    mod = ElasticModulus(root)
    root.mainloop()
